newsitem.title: USA: CBOT soybeans higher on oversold ideas, corn up.
newsitem.headline: CBOT soybeans higher on oversold ideas, corn up.

text.p: U.S. grain and soy complex futures opening as of 0933 CDT.

WHEAT - Steady to 3/4 cent per bushel lower - After the first day, crop scouts on soft red winter wheat tour see very little evidence of disease. Harvest delays in U.S. southern Plains seen as supportive.
CORN - 1/2 to two cents a bushel higher - Market's modest recovery on the close Monday inspired fresh buying. Improvement in crop condition ratings seen limiting gains, traders said.

SOYBEANS - One to five cents per bushel higher - Market seen oversold following Monday's sharp declines. Soybean plantings in line with expectations. China also seen buying U.S. soybeans and soymeal, Chinese traders said.
SOY PRODUCTS - Soymeal steady to $1.40 per ton higher, while soyoil up 0.08 to 0.12 cent per lb, mostly in line with soybeans.
